properties.areaDesc: San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire
properties.headline: Freeze Warning issued February 3 at 12:59PM PST until February 5 at 10:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 25 mph with
gusts 40 to 50 mph. Localized gusts to 55 or 60 mph below Cajon
Pass and in the foothills of the San Bernardino Mountains. For
the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures between 25 and 32
degrees, and as low as 22 degrees Wednesday morning.

* WHERE...The Inland Empire. Strongest winds in and near the
foothills. Coldest temperatures in southern portions of the Inland
Empire.

* WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 9 AM PST Wednesday. For the
Freeze Warning, from 10 PM PST this evening through Wednesday
morning.

* IMPACTS...Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages
may result. Difficult travel at times for high profile vehicles.
Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive
vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY
